title: Pathology Report Generation and Multimodal Representation Learning for Cutaneous Melanocytic Lesions
author: Ruben T. Lucassen (University Medical Center Utrecht), Sander P.J. Moonemans (Eindhoven University of Technology), Tijn van de Luijtgaarden (Eindhoven University of Technology), Gerben E. Breimer (University Medical Center Utrecht), Willeke A.M. Blokx (University Medical Center Utrecht), Mitko Veta (Eindhoven University of Technology), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores multimodal models in pathology, specifically in the context of report generation, which could inform methodologies in audio-language modeling and multimodal integration.
background: Automating the generation of detailed pathology reports from histopathological images to alleviate pathologists' workload.
contribution: This paper introduces a vision-language model to generate comprehensive pathology reports for melanocytic lesions, achieving comparable quality to human-written reports for common nevi.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Earlier models mainly generated short summaries or single-sentence reports which lacked complexity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work processes H&E-stained whole slide images to generate extensive reports, overcoming limitations of prior models that addressed simpler tasks or shorter texts.

key_innovation: The model integrates vision-language learning for detailed image-text correspondence, allowing the generation of richer and more nuanced pathology reports than existing methods.
real_world_impact: By streamlining report generation, this approach can significantly reduce the workload of pathologists, potentially improving healthcare efficiency and diagnostics.
limitations: The model's performance drops for rare melanocytic lesions compared to common nevi, indicating variability in its generalizability.

new_terms.H&E-stained: **Hematoxylin and eosin (H&E)** staining is a widely used technique in histology that allows the visualization of tissue structures, commonly employed in pathological examinations.

open_sourcing: All code and model parameters are made publicly available upon acceptance.
